titleStmt.title: James Nailor's recantation, penned, and directed by himself, to all the people of the Lord, gathered and scattered. And may most fitly serve as an antidote against the infectious poyson of damnable heresies, although couched under the most specious vails of pretended sanctity.
To all the people of the Lord, every where, gathered or scattered.
titleStmt.author: Naylor, James, 1617?-1660.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Edward Farnham and are to be sold at his shop in Popes-head-Alley,

notesStmt.note: Also published in the same year as: To all the people of the Lord, every where, gathered or scattered.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
